Comment: Shopping for a new car? There's a discount when using The Straight Pipes link tsp.truecar.com

My Porsche dealership experience itself has always been great, but you guys aren't wrong about delaying on "cheaper" models. Was stuck between a Spyder and GTS 4.0, the wait for Spyder was 8-12 months, GTS 4.0 would have been well over a year IF they could even get one. Obviously I went for the Spyder haha
The back seat/trunk space part was amazing! It gave me a better feel for what it would actually be like to live with! Thank you for the extra work that you put in to get that shot!
Please do more of the back seat/trunk space scenes! It's incredibly relevant for someone actually looking to purchase this car and you guys did it super efficiently and amazingly!

The first shipments and allocations for the 2022’s were actually the base cars. They sell way more lightly optioned base Macans than anything else. Given they know where their bread is buttered it isn’t hard at all to a get a lightly optioned one. Your tester actually has a lot of options. In fact that matte texture on the dash panel is leather and that is a fairly pricey upgrade over the standard Piano Black (though wood and Aluminium are now available at no extra cost)

Good review of a base model, that is good to see.  Often only up-model versions are reviewed but some of us are aiming a little lower as a starting point into a brand.  Your videography and editing are quite good.
Guys this was an amazing review loved every part of  it.and the new segment where Jakub reviews the seating capacity is a great welcome.️
Considering the next-gen Mecan is supposed to go fully EV, this might be the bargain ICE Porsche to buy right now. Love the looks, it's always been my favorite German SUV. Great review guys!
I love that you guys did the rear seats and cargo!   Really well done guys!  It's great to see this for reference and, it really helps family guys!
1:30, really enjoyed this bit.  A nice upgrade in presentation.  Would also LOVE if you would provide the vehicle's weight along side horsepower and torque.

I leased a base 2021 Macan and absolutely love it. Completely agree that it is a starter Porsche meant to get you into the brand. I can state that it is difficult for me to plan on driving anything else moving forward (I realize I am lucky to be in the situation) ... I hope to upgrade to a Taycan next. Overall the drive and feel for the road are unlike anything else I have driven. It's a fun car to drive and the brand experience at the dealership is top notch. No upselling, they know what they offer and are excited for new buyers as they know they will get you hooked. Macan EV will be awesome to see soon!

Just got this 2022 macan 1 week ago! Absolutley love it as a first time porsche owner.  So far everything is pretty similar to what you said. I noticed the same thing you mentioned about the engine, but roughly 1000kms in I feel like its starting to get smoother as I drive it more on a daily basis. Plus the car is starting to pop and bruble alot more in sport mode 1st gear 3k-4k range.

Love our base model Macan!  Test driving it back to back with a Q5, X3 and Passport it was clear the Macan is so much better.  Bought it in the first months of the pandemic with a big discount.  Does a great job towing the racecar as well!

When I was deciding between the Macan S or X3 M40i, I ultimately went with the X3 M40i because exactly of the additional headspace and legroom in the back. But the Macan looks a lot better than the X3 in my mind.

As always, I enjoy your videos. I’m contemplating trading my 2020 718 in for a 2022 base Macan that’s pretty well equipped, and beautiful.
I was hopeful to retain the sports car element as I’ve had 4 Porsche sports cars within a utility vehicle. But when you said current Porsche owners might consider it a downgrade to get a base Macan as in essence the driving experience isn’t the same, it made me rethink that pursuit.

Love this review, you guys have covered pretty much all the bases when it comes to the Macan. We’ve been looking at a Macan S for a while now and this review echoes everything I felt during that test drive. Great car, great review.
Appreciate the extra attention payed to the trunk space! The box test is missed, but this is a nice compromise!
It is a really good looking car, unlike some of the other high end suvs. I like the interior of Porsches as well. They are simple and have real gauges.

My absolute dream car, everything that you need. Amazing looks, good performance, gorgeous porsche interior, and enough space for my friends/family/dog. I might rather go for the cayenne if I had the money but honeslty these looks are better (not including the gt turbo)
Would love to see more base models being reviewed since that is what most people are going to be buying.
I just watched this car review TWICE, because that’s how much more production value this one feels like. Loving it.

Well, it's not like I'll ever be in one, but I always liked the old button style of the Macan, even if the slot was empty. Piano black is rarely a good feature to me, still, it's a nice compact looking ride, but the refresh of the Cayenne looks better overall in my eyes.

Gloss piano black is a questionable move, BUT the fact that they hid the blank areas so well is a huge improvement. The blank switches in the previous generations were a huge "oh, look at this friggin cheapskate who didn't spec that switch" move which isn't a way to make a customer feel good about themselves, and that's something Porsche cares a lot about.

Nice review guys.   Gives me a feel and sets expectation for GTS I have on order…..really loaded.  Going to be my 911 on stilts.. Can’t wait to get it.  Should arrive in April.  Love your opener and launches.  Keep it going.

Perfect timing for this review for me, as my wife and I are considering the base Macan to replace our 3 series (and we’re getting a bit tired of BMW’s design trend to consider the X3). Your review strengthens that argument for us :D

My wife is dead set on a Porsche as next car.  With Macan being the cheapest model, it’s definitely on our shopping list.  We really like Panamera, but it’s just a bit too pricy, especially my favorite version Tourismo.  Cayenne is also a a compromise, with V6 standard; but Porsche option pricing can really go crazy.  What do I know.  We are replacing an Acura with literally no options. I do like the fact the Acura can last a long if I keep up the maintenance. Acura is nice enough, but there is always that desire and admiration for Porsches.

Hopefully you guys get to review the 2022 GTS since it is now more rigid, better suspension, and received the Turbo's engine. I have one on order with a March delivery, but really hoping you guys get your hands on one. Great videos, as always.
If the base Macan can be ordered with relatively light options, it can be a pretty good value compared to the competition which are far less sporty.
My mom has a base model with extras on it but it is an absolutely AWESOME car! Amazing interior, comfortable in the back spacious.

I've watched this video over 10 times now now for peace of mind. Great review and can't wait for my 2022 base to come in next month. Sucks the S model is impossible to get which was my first preference. Switching over from an X3, so excited to enter the gateway of the porsche brand.

These have always felt quite small in the back but then again I am 6'3". I can't justify one of these even used when compared to a q5 for x3 because it's so small. If I had a ton of spare throw away cash as the average porsche owner does, I might consider it.
Great idea to test the bases model especially the engine really helps since most buyer go with the base engine

OMG finally!!! That was the one element severely lacking from all of your prior reviews…. When everything was said and done I had no clue how large the interior space was or how much luggage space was on offer. It helps tremendously when stating how tall you are as well, so please keep it up, it’s definitely appreciated!
Having had a 2021 as a loaner I totally agree that it's better than most cars period

Tried one before, but the base seemed pretty cheap with the amount of plastic in the interior for the base model. Not sure about the S or GTS. The X3 seemed to feel more plush interior-wise. Exterior, the Macan is nice.
Why wouldn't they include buttons for the back seats? That seems like a must-have, especially for something as high as this. Regardless, I like this a lot. Nice job guys!
Another great one from TSP.   Love the Macan!  The little clock above the center stack is a must have for blasting down the 401 during rush hour.  That is how you know you have arrived.

Love your reviews and your launches.   Ordered a volcano grey 22 Macan GTS Loaded out.  Will be my jacked up version of a 911….lol.  Can’t wait to get it in the spring.  Truly a great engineered suv and really enjoyed that you can customize your build with Porsche.  Keep ‘em coming.

When we went to buy our Macan (in 2019), we had base model in mind. As we were adding options, price quickly rose up (because Porsche). So the porsche guy goes like: "look, it is getting into high Macan S numbers, we do not have macan S currently, but we have Macan GTS in shop. Wouldn't you want to try it?". 25 minutes later, we were ordering Macan GTS :D. You dont have to sell porsches, these cars sell themselves :D :D :D. (Also, incredible car. I am in love.)

i built an S in the US. came exactly to what i spec’d out. i ordered it in August and it arrived in december- which was earlier than the expected date they gave me of April. 

i love the S- it’s the goldilocks version of the 3 trims. it gets you the engine of last years GTS, with the cleaned up interior of 2022. my only gripe is no full screen carplay. that stinks

Tip: Porsche dealers usually have several decently optioned base Macans that they use as service loaners and then sell (often with their CPO warranty) after a year or 2.  Usually not a bad deal if you want a base model at a discounted price.
Always go for the S – the 4 cylinder is ok, but ist feels it struggles with the car and has to rev high to move. Fuel economy is almost same between base and S. The V6 feels so much better.
They really needed to update this. I've driven the former Macan on multiple occasions as a service loaner and it felt like it was half the price new. That 4 cylinder whine tho.
You should drive more base models since so many people drive these.  I ordered a Macan T which is essentially abase  and it is awesome.
Got a new 2021 Macan S in stock last year with very very limited options. Those speced cars still exist and I’m fine with it

Nothing new, the Macan was always the benchmark in this segment already in 2014.

Build-quality, performance, handling and driving experience still to the edge.

The only drawback are maintenance cost, which depending on the market can be very high in comparison to its sister: Audi Q5.

Yes, many do not know, the Macan is classified a Q5 model variation (German Law).
Nice review thanks! I saw you were able to turn on heated and cooled seats on at full power at the same time…it lets you do that? What happens?

Another great video, thanks.  Since you're doing base models, how about that new RWD BMW 230i in M Sport trim?  I'm sure you'd dig driving it, and not a lot of folks reviewing it.  I know, everyone wants the M240 X Drive, but as a purist's car, the 230 beats the current M240 IMO!

I bought my Base Macan 3 months ago optioned to around $80K, and I was told recently I might get the car by December. 
So there is around a year wait time at this moment.

I test drive Macan GTS yesterday, and placed the order, even the waiting period more than 10 months. Have to say it's the ultimate midsized SUV.
Unfortunately SUVs are getting so good that people choosing them over cars and wagons actually kind of makes sense. It is what it is. This seems like a fantastic option. Awesome video!
Pretty good! I looked at one a year ago just for fun and it was larger then I was expecting. It was pretty good

I would be happy with a car that doesn’t have lane keep assist. I pay attention just fine, I don’t want the steering wheel being controlled by a computer. I do like the cross traffic alerts when I have the signals on, though.

Yeah I’ve driven a 4cyl 2017 Macan before, and the turbo was just super laggy and made the car feel sluggish below 3k RPM. I think an N/A V6 would’ve been a better fit, and in fact that used to be the base engine.

this is literally your 5th Macan review!! I'd say this is the only car u guys reviewed the most out of every car in your automotive journey because this car is this great in every way.

I’ve been in a 22 Kia stinger for about a year and it’s definitely been fun but I’m completely a badge snob I want a Porsche so I test drove a macan .. and needless to say I’m trading the stinger  I hope I don’t regret it either way I’m glad to be in the position where a Porsche is even a option for me .. thanks for the video this helped with my decision

Great quality. Happy 2022. Wishing y’all a great year.  I like this color match better wheel better. More subtle but still a nice extra touch.

it does not really lug the engine, if there is enough torque to fullfill your pedal request it is doing whats best. I think this is a perceived issue from the engine sound at about 2k rpm or below.

How fast were you driving while testing LKA? I believe it only corrects above 40 mph. And if it only has LDW, not LKA, it will only audibly alert you. LKA does have to be turned on in order for steering assist as well.
I bought one and Im picking it up later this week! It will be my first Porsche. You guys have me so hyped right now. Its going to be a great start with the brand.

Porsche dealerships won't allow you to put minimal options on a car because exporters try and illegally purchase PCNA cars to ship overseas. When they do this typically only a few options are installed on the car, so that's why some dealers don't allow "base" spec cars

This is my first comment. I love all your videos especially high end Supercars and top of the range models but this was  great to watch. I definitely would suggest making more entry level reviews as this is something everyday people are keen to watch!!

I have a MY22 GTS on order (2nd in line at my dealer having placed my order in Summer 2021) - FYI its quite the reverse with allocations with them being VERY limited for GTS and there's more of an abundance of base model allocations (you can probably even find base models in dealer inventory now, i.e. PFAFF in Vaughan) because they make so much more compared to the GTS. Not sure demand-wise though if that aligns with allocations... seems the GTS is way more in demand for MY22 compared to last year from what I'm seeing, which is probably because you can option them similar to what a MY21 Turbo was, but for around $15K cheaper. If one feels the 4 banger is down on power, that is easily solved for $500 with an APR ECU tune- brings it up to 310 hp/360 tq. This is a VW EA888 engine after all, so ECU tunes are not new  for  this engine. Probably other companies offer ECU tunes as well. I've had APR and Unitronic Stage I on my GTI's, and it makes a world of difference.

Buy the previous model in GTS spec, or if you get lucky and find a Turbo with all of the GTS’s features (namely the air suspension) PLUS sport chrono, get that one. NEVER buy a base Macan. The S at least gets you PDK, but the real magic of the Macan is that the air suspension (standard in the GTS, but only a 50/50 shot on the used Turbos) let’s you drive to vmax while staying all the way low. When you put it all together the previous model GTS is the best all around 1 vehicle buy under $50k…and no gloss back dash.

6:15:  haha ... I bought a new base Macan as my third Porsche (after two Panameras) because it's the best value in a Porsche, by far ...  And the engine is excellent, lots of pep and good acceleration, as you'd expect from nearly 300 lb-ft of torque...  People get obsessed with 400, 500, 600 hp, but seriously those levels of power are unnecessary for people if you don't drive on the Autobahn or on tracks; people tend to lose track of reality.  The base Macan is a seriously good car to drive, including at high speeds (very stable and planted).  I almost bought a Macan S, then decided that it really wasn't that much better than a base Macan to warrant the much-higher price -- after multiple test drives of both.  And the base gets way better gas mileage than does the S.

Porsche Macan...one of the most overrated and overpriced cars on the market.  Base model over $60k with tax and what do you get?  The last generation Audi platform, out of date infotainment system (No android auto!), cramped rear seats and less trunk space than most SUVs in its class.  Mediocre performance and a bare bones interior.  Other cars/SUVS costing far less, provide far more safety and other features as standard.  But being Porsche, if you want them  expect to pay hugely inflated prices. To get to the same standard of equipment as say, a Mazda CX 5 Signature, you'll be paying close to $80k...basically double the price of the Mazda.  Correction, you can't get to the CX5  level  of features even at that price, since Porsche doesn't offer heads up display on the Macan even as an option!  
BTW the CX5 is significantly faster from 0 to 60 and when I drove the Macan and the CX5 back to back I preferred the Mazda's  combination of ride and handling.  Maybe the Porsche will be better at the limit but be honest, how often do we ever get there?  If you want "real" Porsche performance you need to at least buy the Macan S and then you will be pushing $100K with the options that are standard on "lesser" cars.
And once you own the Porsche you are going to pay inflated prices for servicing.  But surely you get better quality?  Well, no.  Consumer Reports ranks Porsche 13th in reliability well behind Lexus and Mazda and even beaten by Chrysler. 
So basically you buy a Macan in the hope it impresses your friends...but they probably think your are a pretentious idiot for wasting that much money.
